item.title: The Boot.dev 2025 Hackathon
item.description:
Have you ever participated in a hackathon? I hadn’t until a month ago.

Boot.dev’s first hackathon was announced July 22nd, and had three days to plan until the start of the hackathon on the 25th. I was thinking about what to make for it for 2 of those days.

Suddenly, my friend, Kyren, asked me if I wanted to join him and another member of Boot.dev, GottZ, on a team.

Showcase

  • CPU vs AI, a tower-defense written with two others for Boot.dev’s 2025 hackathon.
  • parbyte, a library for parsing binary formats into structs.
  • XBF, a Brainf compiler with multiple backends written in Rust (btw).
  • RS-100, the assembly dialect from TIS-100 in a natively runnable form.
  • Luext, a Vim-like text editor made with Lua and the Love2D game engine.
  • ReqProc, a concatenative stack-oriented language.
  • Raisin, a VM-based superset of Brainf.
  • Velvet, a JVM- and CLR- like stack-based virtual machine.
  • ANA, a functional scripting language written in Rust.
  • Templ, a template generation tool.
  • JIL, an interpreted language with manual memory management.
